page.title: 08ASCENSION DAY, HIGH HAM
page.content: For over 90 years on Ascension Day all the children from the village school have walked in procession to the church carrying flowers to decorate the chancel screen and a cross. In recent years a large crown was made replacing the cross.The vicar takes the service and dresses the screen. The crown is filled with flowers and the Chairman of School Governors and the Headteacher raise the crown to the top of the rood screen, symbolising the ascension of Christ from the Mount. After the service the Vicar joins the Headteacher in leading the children who will be leaving the school that summer to the top of the church tower, again a symbol of the occasion. Traditionally the children were given the day off in celebration, but nowadays this holiday is given at other times of the year.
